class.name: KinematicCollision3D
class.description: Contains collision data for [method PhysicsBody3D.move_and_collide] collisions. When a [PhysicsBody3D] is moved using [method PhysicsBody3D.move_and_collide], it stops if it detects a collision with another body. If a collision is detected, a [KinematicCollision3D] object is returned. This object contains information about the collision, including the colliding object, the remaining motion, and the collision position. This information can be used to calculate a collision response.

method.name: get_angle
method.description: The collision angle according to [code]up_direction[/code], which is [code]Vector3.UP[/code] by default. This value is always positive.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Returns the collider by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_collider_id
method.description: Returns the collider ID by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_collider_metadata
method.description: Returns the collider metadata by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_collider_rid
method.description: Returns the collider RID by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the collider shape by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_collider_shape_index
method.description: Returns the collider shape index by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_collider_velocity
method.description: Returns the collider velocity by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_local_shape
method.description: Returns the collider velocity by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_normal
method.description: Returns the collider normal by index (the latest by default).

method.name: get_position
method.description: Returns the collider collision point by index (the latest by default).

members.member: The colliding body's unique instance ID. See [method Object.get_instance_id].
The colliding body's [RID] used by the [PhysicsServer3D].
The colliding body's shape's normal at the point of collision.
The point of collision, in global coordinates.
The moving object's remaining movement vector.
The distance the moving object traveled before collision.
